overview_summary: All five neighboring landowners are private Berkeley County residents with no documented public stance on development or clean energy projects. None are known community leaders or officials, and all appear to have relatively low profiles and influence in local affairs.

neighbors.name: Todd A. Gladfelter & Karen Gladfelter
neighbors.claims: Todd A. Gladfelter (age 57) and Karen Gladfelter are listed as owners of a residential property on Michelle Dr in Berkeley County [Veripages](https://veripages.com/name/Todd/Gladfelter/). No record of either holding any local official position or speaking at county meetings could be found in public archives (indicating a low public profile).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via informal, personal outreach to understand any concerns; emphasize respectful communication and community benefits in discussions.

neighbors.name: Jamie G. Roseman & Dianna L. Roseman
neighbors.claims: Jamie G. Roseman and Dianna L. Roseman jointly own property in the Falling Waters area of Berkeley County (no separate business or organizational affiliations were identified in public records)[Berkeley County Assessor](https://www.berkeleywv.org)[Martinsburg Journal](https://www.journal-news.net). Neither individual appears in local news or civic documents regarding land use or development debates, suggesting no notable public stance or civic role.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through a friendly introduction at their residence; listen to any questions and share clear, factual information about the project.

neighbors.name: Scott Michael Shimel
neighbors.claims: Scott Michael Shimel is the listed owner of a parcel in Berkeley County, WV, but no biographical or professional information was found in public sources[Berkeley County Assessor](https://www.berkeleywv.org). There are no mentions of Scott M. Shimel in available county meeting minutes or local news reports, indicating no public advocacy or opposition related to development on record.

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a one-on-one conversation to introduce the project and address any concerns; consider a neighborly approach via shared contacts or community events.

neighbors.name: Tyler James Cloud & Jacob Ashby Cloud
neighbors.claims: Tyler James Cloud and Jacob Ashby Cloud are co-owners of a Berkeley County property (their names appear together on the land records)[Berkeley County Assessor](https://www.berkeleywv.org). No public profiles or community leadership roles were found for either; they have not been cited in local newspapers or public meetings regarding land issues, suggesting limited public visibility.

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out through a mutual acquaintance or community gathering if possible; highlight how the project respects local interests and address any questions they may have.

neighbors.name: Michael D. Writt
neighbors.claims: Michael D. Writt is identified as a property owner in Berkeley County with no accompanying business entity (indicating personal ownership)[Berkeley County Assessor](https://www.berkeleywv.org). A search of local public records and media did not reveal any notable civic engagement or statements by Writt concerning development or energy projects, implying a low-key presence in the community.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage in a respectful, informative manner at his convenience; provide reassurances about the project’s adherence to community standards and invite him to ask questions.
